items.title: iPhone 6
items.text: Apple iPhone 6 smartphone was launched in September 2014. The phone comes with a 4.70-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 750 pixels by 1334 pixels at a PPI of 326 pixels per inch.

items.title: iPhone 7
items.text: Apple iPhone 7 smartphone was launched in September 2016. The phone comes with a 4.70-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 750 pixels by 1334 pixels at a PPI of 326 pixels per inch.

items.title: iPhone 5s
items.text: Apple iPhone 5s smartphone was launched in September 2013. The phone comes with a 4.00-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 640 pixels by 1136 pixels at a PPI of 326 pixels per inch.

items.title: iPad Air 2
items.text: Apple iPad Air 2 Wi-Fi tablet was launched in October 2014. The tablet comes with a 9.70-inch display with a resolution of 1536 pixels by 2048 pixels at a PPI of 264 pixels per inch.

items.title: BMW 5er F10
items.text: The BMW F10 is the sixth generation of the BMW 5 Series, which debuted in November 2009[9] as the successor to the E60 5 Series.

items.title: Ferrari
items.text: The Ferrari F40 is a mid-engine, rear-wheel drive, two-door coup√© sports car[4] built from 1987 to 1992, with the LM and GTE race car versions continuing production until 1994 and 1996 respectively.

items.title: Land Rover Range Rover
items.text: The Range Rover is a British made, full-sized luxury sport utility vehicle (SUV) produced by Land Rover, and serves as its flagship model. Land Rover is one of several auto manufacturers owned by Tata Motors, a part of the Indian multinational conglomerate Tata Group.
